meanings.definition: To shake involuntarily from fear or excitement.
meanings.sent1: She began to tremble when she heard a loud noise.
meanings.sent2: The little puppy would tremble with excitement every time its owner came home.
meanings.sent3: The leaf continued to tremble even after the wind had stopped blowing.
meanings.sent4: His voice caused her heart to tremble with emotion.
meanings.sent5: The ground seemed to tremble beneath their feet as the earthquake struck.

meanings.sent1: The tremble in her hands was noticeable as she held the delicate glass.
meanings.sent2: The tremble of the tree leaves added a peaceful rhythm to the garden.
meanings.sent3: The tremble in his voice made it hard for others to take him seriously.
meanings.sent4: The tremble of excitement in the air was palpable before the surprise party.
meanings.sent5: The slight tremble in the water revealed the presence of a hidden fish.
